history: Traditionally gender neutral, became masculine when separate gender-differentiated pronouns like 她 were introduced under western influence.
Pronounced identically as 他, introduced under western influence.
Feminine second person pronoun 妳 is used mainly in Taiwan.
伊 was used historically in 1870-1930 as an exclusively feminine pronoun.
Pinyin "tā" or "ta" used as a gender neutral pronoun.
Invented in 2015 by an intersex community called The Missing Gender 0.972 (https://www.facebook.com/intersex0.972/).
佢 is a loanword from Cantonese used as a neutral pronoun by some people in Hong Kong.
Second person pronoun 祢 is used mainly in Taiwan.
牠 is used mainly in Taiwan.
Zhuyin ㄊㄚused as a gender neutral pronoun.
